p: In Piper species, this oxygenated sesquiterpenoid can be found in P. dilatatum (13.8–28.7%) [ 54] and P. hispidum (4.9–12.9%) [ 59, 69]. Another well-known species that presents curzerene as one of the main components is Eugenia uniflora, commonly known as “pitanga”, an arboreous plant widely distributed in Brazil and other South American countries and possesses antifungal activity against Candida spp., and its EO presents antiproliferative and cytotoxic effects against some cancer strains [ 70, 71].
